findings.title: Unhandled Error in FeesCollected Insertion Leading to Potential Node Crash
findings.description: The pallet-ocex-lmp pallet experiences a node crash due to an unhandled error resulting from an unchecked conversion from an unlimited vec to a limited BoundedVec.

findings.title: Inaccurate Signature Threshold Calculation
findings.description: The signature threshold calculation in the submit_snapshot function uses a 'round down' approach, which can lead to a lower signature threshold than intended.

findings.title: Vector of unlimited size in thea-executor
findings.description: The `ApprovedDeposits` storage value uses a `Vec` data structure without a limit on its size, which can lead to memory exhaustion and DoS attacks.

findings.title: Polkadex Node Fails to Execute
findings.description: The Polkadex node cannot execute with the current Rust toolchain configuration due to misconfiguration.

findings.title: Compilation and Linter Warnings
findings.description: Polkadex L1 Substrate chain has a clean build with a minor single dependency warning related to nalgebra within linregress dependency of benchmarking FRAME pallet.

findings.title: Employment of Sudo Pallet
findings.description: The sudo FRAME pallet is currently leveraged as an alternative to the governance mechanism, which raises potential centralization concerns and is a less desirable design choice.

findings.title: Inconsistent and Misleading Comments and Logs in Thea Codebase
findings.description: The codebase for Thea contains misleading comments and logs copied from Orderbook client codebase, which can lead to confusion and misinterpretation.

findings.title: Incorrect Use of Bitwise OR Operator
findings.description: Using bitwise OR operator instead of logical OR operator can lead to confusion and potential issues when the code is modified in the future.

findings.title: Magic Numbers As Constants in pallets
findings.description: Usage of magic numbers as constant, directly hardcoded in pallets code, can lead to maintainability, readability, and potential security issues.

findings.title: Missing Benchmark Calculations
findings.description: The project lacks benchmark calculations for extrinsic weights of several pallets, and some hooks return incorrect weights, leading to inaccurate transaction fee calculations, imbalanced resource consumption, and potential vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Non-Idiomatic Error Handling in `collect_fees` Function of `pallet-ocex-lmp` Pallet
findings.description: The error handling approach in the `collect_fees` function of the `pallet-ocex-lmp` pallet is not idiomatic in Rust, which may ignore potential errors in the event of a failure and could complicate debugging.

findings.title: Redundant declaration of AllowlistedTokenLimit struct
findings.description: Duplicating the get methods for the `AllowlistedTokenLimit` structure in multiple pallets is considered a bad practice, as it can lead to readability and maintainability issues.

findings.title: Superfluous Else Clause
findings.description: The bitwise OR operator (|) is used instead of the logical OR operator (||), which can lead to confusion and potential issues when the code is modified in the future.

findings.title: Superfluous Implementation of Hooks Trait
findings.description: The utilization of the `Hooks` trait without implementing any of its methods does not lead to any immediate detrimental effects. However, it is superfluous and can potentially reduce code readability while increasing complexity.

findings.title: Unmaintained ChainBridge pallet
findings.description: The ChainBridge Substrate pallet is no longer maintained by its creators, ChainSafe, and the official GitHub repository has been archived.

findings.title: Unnecessary 'hashing.rs' File in Polkadex Chainbridge Pallet
findings.description: The Polkadex `chainbridge` pallet includes an unnecessary file named `_hashing.rs`, which is not utilized in the pallet's implementation and contains redundant functions.

findings.title: Unsafe arithmetics
findings.description: Some calculations were performed without considering the possibility of overflows.
